title: Starship 36 Explodes During Static Fire Testing
summary: At 11:01 PM Central Time the night of June 18th, Starship 36 exploded on its test stand prior to a planned static fire test. Ship 36 was planned to be used for Flight 10, so its loss throws the immediate future of the Starship program into question.

title: Portal Space Systems to build larger factory for Supernova vehicle
summary:
Portal Space Systems will create a second factory to scale up production of high-performance in-space vehicles as it gears up for initial test flights in 2026.

title: The Exploration Company Unveils Proposed Crew Capsule
summary:
During the first day of the Paris Air Show in Le Bourget, The Exploration Company unveiled a crewed version of its Nyx spacecraft. According to the company, if the political will exists, the proposed crew-rated capsule could be ready for its inaugural flight no earlier than 2035. summary:

title: First MetOp-SG and Sentinel-5 arrive at launch site
summary: Europe will soon be taking another leap forward in its weather forecasting capacity as the first MetOp Second Generation, MetOp-SG-A1, satellite arrives safely at Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana, marking a pivotal moment on the road to launch.
